blocks.name: pfxccat3
blocks.content: The subword of a concatenation is either a subword of the first concatenated word or a subword of the second concatenated word or a concatenation of a suffix of the first word with a prefix of the second word. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 30-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 10-May-2020.)

blocks.name: swrdccat
blocks.content: The subword of a concatenation of two words as concatenation of subwords of the two concatenated words. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 29-May-2018.)
blocks.origin:

  -| wceq(c5, cfv(chash, c0))
} = {
  ex(wa(wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wcel(c2, cword(c1))), wa(wcel(c3, co(nat0, cfz, c4)), wcel(c4, co(nat0, cfz, co(c5, caddc, cfv(chash, c2))))), wceq(co(co(c0, cconcat, c2), csubstr, cop(c3, c4)), co(co(c0, csubstr, cop(c3, cif(c4, c5, wbr(c4, cle, c5)))), cconcat, co(c2, csubstr, cop(cif(co(c3, cmin, c5), nat0, wbr(nat0, cle, co(c3, cmin, c5))), co(c4, cmin, c5))))))

blocks.name: swrdccat3b
blocks.content: A suffix of a concatenation is either a suffix of the second concatenated word or a concatenation of a suffix of the first word with the second word. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 31-Mar-2018.) (Revised by Alexander van der Vekens, 30-May-2018.) (Proof shortened by AV, 14-Oct-2022.)

  sylib(wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wcel(cfv(chash, c0), co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))), wcel(cfv(chash, c0), cn0))

  3ad2ant3(wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wcel(c2, cword(c1)), wceq(c3, cfv(chash, c0)), wb(wcel(c3, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))), wcel(cfv(chash, c0), co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)))))

blocks.name: reuccatpfxs1
blocks.content: There is a unique word having the length of a given word increased by 1 with the given word as prefix if there is a unique symbol which extends the given word. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 6-Oct-2018.) (Revised by AV, 21-Jan-2022.) (Revised by AV, 13-Oct-2022.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: reuccatpfxs1v
blocks.content: There is a unique word having the length of a given word increased by 1 with the given word as prefix if there is a unique symbol which extends the given word. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 6-Oct-2018.) (Revised by AV, 21-Jan-2022.) (Revised by AV, 10-May-2022.) (Proof shortened by AV, 13-Oct-2022.)
